title: Great Communicator and Fantastic Guide
text:
From the time that we booked Cara, we were excited with her excellent communication with us in order to learn more about what we were interested in for Yellowstone.

Overall, our experience with Cara was wonderful. When we met she had amazing hot chocolate, tea, and coffee for us. From there we communicated via radio (during COVID) as we drove to the various sights. She had 3 fantastic spotting scopes which allowed us to see plenty of wildlife. But, the best thing was being able to tell that she truly cared about the animals. Whenever we saw one we did not know who was more excited (Cara or us). Lastly, she brings her own camera (see attached photos) and will take both videos and photos of animals for you.

Was our best guide in Yellowstone and highly recommend.

title: Amazing Time
text: Stayed here for 5 nights during my graduate trip celebration and was treated to some of the best food ever by Chef Tim and great hospitality by Meg, Shawn, and Josh. We fished for 3 days in total from the lodge with 2 days from the drift boat and 1 day of wade fishing. Overall, a phenomenal time and would recommend to anyone who wants to have a special vacation.

title: Amazing Fishing and Wonderful Hosts
text: This was our first time to Montana and mostly stayed at the Madison River Lodge. Overall, the experience was phenomenal with excellent communication from Montana Anglers and fantastic guides who kept us constantly busy catching fish and were enjoyable to talk with during the trip. It was incredibly easy to book and Montana Angler provides everything. Just show up and have some of the best fishing/travel time of your life.

title: Malt and Hard Shakes
text: Not only did this place have amazing burgers and fries, but it had both spectacular shakes for the under 21 age and hard shakes for those who wanted something special ;)

title: Better than France
text: This crepe cart allowed you to add pretty much any sweet or savory topping that you could want and thus, in its American way, was better than the crespes that I have had in Fance.

title: Amazing View, Hot-tub, and Beds
text:
This was my family's first time staying in Breckenridge and Gold Point was amazing. Waking-up and seeing the mountains across the way and then finishing the day by relaxing in a hot-tub and seeing the same view was amazing. The bus was easy to take into town, but we mainly drove, since one of us could not ski. The beds were very comfy and the kitchen had enough supplies for all 5 of us.

As an ending note: there is a sign to use the second turn-in lane to access the check-in

title: Great Place for Brunch
text: Not only does Avalon have a great brunch menu for food, but also creative seasonal drinks. I loved my peppermint coffee concoction to go with the avocado toast.

title: Best Short Ribs
text: While the restaurant is small and can have a wait, the kitchen is pretty quick and the food is delicious. My favorite dish is the short ribs.

title: Great AA Ice Cream
text: Always enjoy stopping at Blank Slate and having one of their original flavors of ice cream. Even without ordering a waffle cone you can get the off-shoots of them to taste. I also love trying the outside game with the hook and disk.

title: Best Tacos in Michigan
text: Absolutely amazing tacos. Fantastic fish tacos for Lent/ any Friday meal. The carne asada taco was my favorite meat one. My brother and I split 8 tacos and two tamales.

title: Lake Orion Classic
text: I grew up going here every Friday for breakfast and fell in love with their chocolate chip pancakes. They also have some of the best toast in the world, Cinnamon Raisin Toast!

title: Tour and Samples
text: Very friendly staff to welcome you at the door and bought a coffee before the tour. The tour was very informative and interesting. Seeing the actual machines and people working was fantastic. There is no actual production on the weekends. After the tour stopped by the shop for some samples and buying more chocolate. Butlers chocolate is top-notch and better than Belgian or Switz chocolates that I have had abroad.

title: Great for a Quick Visit
text: A very nice way to spend an hour or two of your time in the heart of Edinburgh. They have a few famous paintings, the big deer one (very technical) and has one of my favorite paintings of flowers (also attached). Has a nice postcard stand in the middle of a room with a very talkative lady working it. The building is currently under renovations, so not all the paintings are up, but in a few years will be even better.

title: Great for All Ages
text: They have a massive pipe organ that plays during specific times and the organist was amazing. The whole building is well laid-out and has plenty of cool paintings.

title: Great Tour Guide and Sights
text: A very friendly tour guide who was actually English, but has lived in Scotland for the last several years. One of the highlights of the tour was stopping on the side of the road and feeding some of the special cows carrots. Stirling Castle’s audio guide was really informative and told the history of the castle via different points. Please note, the castle is not under one-roof, so an umbrella or raincoat is needed if it is raining outside.

title: St. Paul and Democracy
text: Easy stop on the way down from the Acropolis that has two important events that happened here. First, via history timeline, was the founding of the idea of democracy (voting) was founded here. Second, the fact that Paul addressed the Athenians from this location. Has an easy walk-way up on the left-side.

title: Great Views and Easy to Read Signs
text: Acropolis was cool to see and had no wait for tickets in early May. The signs are in Greek and English so if you walk around and just read those then you will easily understand the sites. If you can, then walk past the Acropolis at night to see it lit up in all its glory. It was amazing to see how sprawling the city of Athens was from the top of this mountain.

title: Best Night Life in Santorini
text: Probably one of the best bars I have been to in my life. If you are looking for a great drink deal before dinner (2 drinks for 12 euros) or the best late night-life in Santorini then look no further. The drinks and hookah here are amazing. The staff are also very considerate and do a great job overall. My friends and I sat at a table for 2 hours on Saturday night and loved it.

title: The View
text: Beautiful view. If you can grab a table on the top, then the view from there is spectacular. A fantastic way to watch the sunset. The waitstaff is also kind. Overall, the absinthe drink was delicious, and the stuffed calamari was wonderful. The sea bass gyro was good but not as spectacular as the calamari.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Was truly an oasis in the town of Fira. While I was there the reception was under construction, but they were able to take my bags before the room was available and then delivered them to the room when we checked-in. The best part was the hot-tub (in the honeymoon suite) and the closeness to the ATV rental/downtown Fira.

title: Very good food, not a tourist trap
text: Just wait outside the door or around the corner until you are given a seat. This place has amazing schnitzel and nice wait staff, though they did ask for a tip which was strange.

title: Religious and Imperial Artifacts
text: The wealth of the Habsburg dynasty was crazy. The museum is very well done and audio guide is great. If Catholic they have a part of the true cross and nail.

title: Better than the Lourve
text:
This museum I had 0 expectations before going in. The artwork and artifacts were amazing quality. The audio guide was very helpful as well as the tablets on the benches.

Tip: if you forget to buy ahead, make the purchase on your phone via their website, since the line outside is just to buy tickets.

title: Amazing Time
text:
This castle was absolutely amazing. We were a little late for our check-in, but called ahead and it worked out fine. We stayed in one of the suites and it was very comfy. The beds have been the comfiest on the trip so far. The morning views from the castle were amazing. We headed downstairs for a great breakfast and then was given a tour of the castle. The history behind the place was very interesting.

If you love peace and quiet, but still an amazing place to stay, this is right for you.

Tip: since this place isn’t an all inclusive with a restaurant, you can stop in town 10 minutes north of the place and grab some food to either cook up or take-out and eat at the castle, since the kitchen is very nice.

title: Fantastic Walk
text: We stayed at the Causeway Hotel which was very pleasant, so it was easy to walk over in the morning. The staff there were very friendly in the visitor center, especially Jeff who was handing out the amazing audio guides. There is a bus, but my family and I all walked down the path. It can be slightly slippery if after it rains, but overall amazing.

title: Great Tapas
text:
Went there with my family and had a fantastic meal. Downstairs was pleasant and less people. Food came out quickly, but almost too quick. Staff was very friendly.

Our favorite tapa: lamb and sweet potatoes skewer

title: Fantastic Food and Friendly Staff
text: The place is tiny, but super nice. For dinner on Sunday they let you choose between 2-3 courses. All their food was amazing. I had the suckling pig and the rest of my family ordered hake. Only disappointment was no Guinness.

title: Great Meatballs and Reindeer
text: I had the meatballs and my friend had the reindeer steak. Both were delicious. Very big restaurant with good atmosphere. The beer Falcon was also delicious. The Swedish cheesecake was very weird, would not recommend. New York style is much better.

title: Great Newcastle and Fish & Chips
text: Great little pub where not that many restaurants are. Simply went there for a great beer and fish. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would come back.

title: Walked through in 10 miutes
text: I usually love alcohol museums, but this was boring. Had 1 room with inflatable swans, the next about food in 2050, how it’s like to experience a hangover, some smells of alcohol, empty tasting room, and that’s it. There was no mention of Absolut Vodka anywhere.

title: Top 3 Museum in Stockholm
text: Very nice museum in Stockholm that was 1/2 to have a wait to get in (other was Vasa). The main exhibition is always free and has plenty of English translations. Very well done and plenty of noteworthy artists.

title: Fantastic experience and Food
text:
Important: have to check your bag and coat at entrance

The host is a massive Viking who loudly announces your name as others bang on the table. The food is delicious and the waiters dress up in viking clothes. Overall, best meal in Stockholm.

title: Fantastic bakery
text:
Important: as you go in take a ticket to be served (like a deli counter ticket)

Great food and friendly staff explaining the various rolls in English. Small, but delightful eating area.

title: Weird layout and no real talk about Nobel
text: Went there expecting to have a massive history about Nobel and what each of the medals mean, history behind, and how they select the winners. There is a tucked away display about Nobel, but nothing else. They have an interactive station where you can read about every Nobel winner, but kinda slow. Lastly, 1/3 of the museum is dedicated to MLK. Just seems kinda out of the place, but nice part.

title: If you like Palaces go, if not skip
text: Nothing really that cool about this museum. Kinda just walk around some old rooms that used to be where the kings lived. As an American didn’t feel that special.

title: Interesting
text: There seems to be 3 different artists in different areas that rotate. They have tons of pictures from each artists and a video about their work. I loved the one where the photographer faked famous people, very funny pictures. Also, great bar/diner up top.

title: Just like Greenfield Village, but more stuff
text: Very cool layout of the grounds with plenty of things to see with families. There was a skating rink and some delicious almonds next to it. Lastly, the animals were very cool, first time ever seeing a Wolverine, my school mascot. Would be better in summer due to more being opened.

title: Best Ship Museum
text: This is a must do in Stockholm. The size of this ship was much larger than expected and the fact about how original the wreck is blows my mind. The whole museum is very interactive and fun to walk around.

title: Amazing Meringue Dishes
text: I initially saw this place by watching the various bakers freshly make their desserts. My friend and I then went in and had an amazing meringue dessert that was very reasonably priced. I love the vanilla chocolate one and he loved the dark chocolate one.

title: Great Burgers and Salads
text: Love the atmosphere of this bar when the Lions are playing. Unfortunately, the atmosphere does little to improve the Lions chance of winning. They have a weird selection of burgers with toppings that you won’t find elsewhere in SE-Michigan. My mom loves their various salads and always has to take home half since they are massive.
